chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
u: nat
n: nat
i: nat
v: Vector.t nat n

Goal:
divides (qs u) (encode_state (i, v)) <-> divides (qs u) (exp 0 v)

Premises:
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, pos (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
qs = {| str := fun n : nat => nthprime (1 + 2 * n); str_inj := fun (n m : nat) (H : nthprime (1 + 2 * n) = nthprime (1 + 2 * m)) => let H0 : 1 + 2 * n = 1 + 2 * m := nthprime_inj (1 + 2 * n) (1 + 2 * m) H in (fun lemma : n = m <-> BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (n = m) (BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m) lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat BinNums.Z eq BinInt.Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Znat.Nat2Z
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
encode_state = fun (n : nat) (c : nat * vec nat n) => ps (fst c) * exp 0 (snd c) : forall n : nat, nat * vec nat n -> nat Arguments encode_state {n}%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Module Vector := Struct Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, t A n -> t A (S n) Definition t_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Type), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h ## t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t. Definition t_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Prop), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h
exp = fix exp (n i : nat) (v : vec nat n) {struct v} : nat := match v with | vec_nil => 1 | Vector.cons _ x n0 v0 => qs i ^ x * exp n0 (S i) v0 end : forall n : nat, nat -> vec nat n -> nat Arguments exp {n}%nat_scope _%nat_scope
qs_shift : forall (n m j k : nat) (v : vec nat k), divides (qs n) (exp j v) < -> divides (qs (m + n)) (exp (m + j) v)
qs_exp_div : forall (i j n : nat) (v : vec nat n), i < j -> ~ divides (qs i) (exp j v)
qs_ps_div : forall n m : nat, ~ divides (qs n) (ps m)
ps_qs_div : forall n m : nat, ~ divides (ps n) (qs m)
divides_encode_state : forall (i k n : nat) (v : vec nat n), divides (ps i) (encode_state (k, v)) -> i = k
modS_divide : forall n p : nat, p mod S n = 0 < -> divides (S n) p
divides_rem_eq : forall q p : nat, divides p q < -> rem q p = 0
ps_exp : forall (n m : nat) (v : vec nat m) (i : nat), ~ divides (ps n) (exp i v)
divides_bool_spec : forall n p : nat, divides_bool (S n) p = true < -> divides (S n) p
divides_0 : forall p : nat, divides p 0
divides_0_inv : forall p : nat, divides 0 p -> p = 0
divides_pow : forall p n k : nat, prime p -> divides p (n ^ k) -> divides p n
divides_mult_inv_l : forall p q r : nat, divides (p * q) r -> divides p r /\ divides q r
divides_mult_inv : forall p x y : nat, prime p -> divides p (x * y) -> divides p x \/ divides p y
divides_mult_r : forall p q k : nat, divides p q -> divides p (q * k)
divides_mult : forall p q k : nat, divides p q -> divides p (k * q)
power_factor_uniq : forall p i j x y : nat, p <> 0 -> ~ divides p x -> ~ divides p y -> p ^ i * x = p ^ j * y -> i = j /\ x = y
divides_refl : forall x : nat, divides x x
primestream_divides : forall (ps : primestream) (n m : nat), divides (ps n) (ps m) -> n = m
divides_1_inv : forall p : nat, divides p 1 -> p = 1
Nat.mod_divide : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> a mod b = 0 < -> Nat.divide b a
prime_divides : forall p q : nat, prime p -> prime q -> divides p q -> p = q
mma_sss_sind : forall (n : nat) (P : mm_instr (pos n) -> mm_state n -> mm_state n -> SProp), (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (v : vec nat n), P (INCₐ x) (i, v) (1 + i, v[(S (v#>x))/x])) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n), v#>x = 0 -> P (DECₐ x k) (i, v) (1 + i, v)) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n) (u : nat), v#>x = S u -> P (DECₐ x k) (i, v) (k, v[u/x])) ->...-> P m m0 m1
mma_sss_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : mm_instr (pos n) -> mm_state n -> mm_state n -> Prop), (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (v : vec nat n), P (INCₐ x) (i, v) (1 + i, v[(S (v#>x))/x])) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n), v#>x = 0 -> P (DECₐ x k) (i, v) (1 + i, v)) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n) (u : nat), v#>x = S u -> P (DECₐ x k) (i, v) (k, v[u/x])) ->...-> P m m0 m1
mm_sss_sind : forall (n : nat) (P : mm_instr (pos n) -> mm_state n -> mm_state n -> SProp), (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (v : vec nat n), P (INCₐ x) (i, v) (1 + i, v[(S (v#>x))/x])) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n), v#>x = 0 -> P (DECₐ x k) (i, v) (k, v)) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n) (u : nat), v#>x = S u -> P (DECₐ x k) (i, v) (1 + i, v[u/x])) ->...-> P m m0 m1
mm_sss_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : mm_instr (pos n) -> mm_state n -> mm_state n -> Prop), (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (v : vec nat n), P (INCₐ x) (i, v) (1 + i, v[(S (v#>x))/x])) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n), v#>x = 0 -> P (DECₐ x k) (i, v) (k, v)) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n) (u : nat), v#>x = S u -> P (DECₐ x k) (i, v) (1 + i, v[u/x])) ->...-> P m m0 m1
mm_special_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n))) (se : nat * vec nat n) (Q : nat * vec nat n -> Prop), Q se -> (forall (i : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)) (v : vec nat n) (j : nat) (w : vec nat n), (i, [ρ]) <sc P -> ρ // (i, v) -1> (j, w) -> sss_compute (mm_sss (n:=n)) P (j, w) se -> Q (j, w) -> Q (i, v)) -> forall s : nat * vec nat n, sss_compute (mm_sss (n:=n)) P s se -> Q s
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_iff : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m < -> n = m
mm_term_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n))) (se : nat * vec nat n) (Q : nat * vec nat n -> Prop), (out_code (fst se) P -> Q se) -> (forall (i : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)) (v : vec nat n) (j : nat) (w : vec nat n), (i, [ρ]) <sc P -> ρ // (i, v) -1> (j, w) -> sss_output (mm_sss (n:=n)) P (j, w) se -> Q (j, w) -> Q (i, v)) -> forall s : nat * vec nat n, sss_output (mm_sss (n:=n)) P s se -> Q s

```coq
split.
- intros H.
  rewrite encode_state_eq in H.
  apply divides_encode_state in H.
  rewrite H.
  apply qs_exp_div.
  auto.
- intros H.
  rewrite encode_state_eq.
  apply qs_shift with (j:=0) (v:=v).
  auto.
Qed.

original: split. - intros H. rewrite encode_state_eq in H. apply divides_encode_state in H. rewrite H. apply qs_exp_div. auto. - intros H. rewrite encode_state_eq. apply qs_shift with (j:=0) (v:=v). auto.
